text: Basukinath is a city and notified area in the Dumka, Jharkhand, India. ==Location== Basukinath is located in the Dumka district of Jharkhand. The district lies on the Deoghar-Dumka state highway, about 25 kilometres northwest of Dumka. Ranchi Airport is the nearest airport and is located on Jarmundi Block by the Dumka Deoghar State Highway. ==Demographics== Indian census, Basukinath has a population of 14,119 (52% men, 48% women). Basukinath has an average literacy rate of 54%, which is lower than the national average of 59.5%; with 62% of men and 38% of women literate. 17% of the population is under 6 years of age. ==Religion== Basukinath serves as a place of pilgrimage for Hindus. The Basukinath Temple is an attraction and situated along the Jasidih Dumka New Railway Line. Lord Shiva at Basukinath Dham, Jharkhand, India ===Shravan mela=== Devotees of Shiva moving chanting Bol Bam Basukinath is famous for the mela of Shraavana (a month of the Hindu calendar), between July and August. Some pilgrims are called "Bol Bam" when they pour holy water on the shivling after 4–5 days of journeying. The pilgrims en route to Basukinath also visit the Baidyanath Jyotirlinga in Deogarh. ==Ram Janki Vivah Utsav== Pandit Nainalal Jha and Pradhan Tirth Purohit Baba Basukinath started the festival of "Ram Janki Vivah Utsav" in Basukinath. A baraat which included elephants and horses participated in the procession as well. In present day the festival has been continued by his son Pandit Tara Kant Jha. ==References== Category:Cities and towns in Dumka district
